meanings.definition: Twist or bend out of the normal shape
meanings.sent1: She tried to contort her body to fit into the tiny box.
meanings.sent2: The acrobat contorted her limbs into a pretzel-like shape.
meanings.sent3: The contorting clown made everyone laugh at the circus.
meanings.sent4: His face contorted in pain as he tried to lift the heavy weight.
meanings.sent5: The contorted tree branches reached out like twisted fingers.

meanings.definition: To twist or wrench out of a natural or normal shape or condition
meanings.sent1: He had to contort the metal wire to fix the broken fence.
meanings.sent2: The magician contorted the balloon animals into different shapes.
meanings.sent3: The contorting balloon artist amazed the children at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her words contorted his face into a puzzled expression.
meanings.sent5: The contorted path through the forest led to a hidden waterfall.

meanings.definition: To twist or bend severely out of shape
meanings.sent1: The old book had pages that were contorted from years of use.
meanings.sent2: The contorted metal sculpture resembled a twisted tree.
meanings.sent3: The contorting metal artist created unique sculptures.
meanings.sent4: His contorted expression showed his confusion at the riddle.
meanings.sent5: The contorted road ahead warned of a difficult journey.
